abstract: A study released on Monday found that there was insufficient data to conclude that dust and pollution in the war zones of Iraq and Afghanistan could cause long-term health problems in troops.
snippet: A study released on Monday found that there was insufficient data to conclude that dust and pollution in the war zones of Iraq and Afghanistan could cause long-term health problems in troops.
lead_paragraph: For many years, troops returning from Iraq and Afghanistan have complained of breathing problems and some have been found with serious illnesses and diseases. Many doctors and researchers focused on one particular culprit: burn pits used by the military to incinerate everything from plastic water bottles to construction materials.

headline.main: Study on 'Burn Pits' Cites Inadequate Evidence of Health Effects
